intro: Pelecyphora abdita, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pelecyphora, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of many members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
